translated: Itivuttaka
The Fours
The Chapter on the Spiritual Life of the Brahmins
The One with Much Service

original: Vuttañhetaṁ bhagavatā vuttamarahatāti me sutaṁ:🔽“Bahukārā, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇagahapatikā tumhākaṁ ye vo paccupaṭṭhitā cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārehi.
analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta  bahu kārā bhikkhave brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tumhākam ye vaḥ paccupaṭṭhitā cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārehi
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha:🔽“Householders and brahmins have been very helpful to you, monks, in that they have served you with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines for the sick.

original: Tumhepi, bhikkhave, bahukārā brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṁ yaṁ nesaṁ dhammaṁ desetha ādikalyāṇaṁ
analyzed: tumhe pi bhikkhave bahu kārāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikānam yam na īsam dhammaṃ desetha ādi kalyāṇa
translated: You, monks, have been very helpful to householders and brahmins in that you have taught them the Dhamma that is good in the beginning,

original: majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ🔽brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
analyzed: majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddha  brahmacariyam pakāsetha
translated: good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, and in that you have revealed the spiritual life that is perfectly complete and purified.

original: Evamidaṁ, bhikkhave, aññamaññaṁ nissāya brahmacariyaṁ vussati oghassa nittharaṇatthāya sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: evam idam bhikkhave aññam aññam nissāya brahmacariyam vussati oghassa nittharaṇa tthāya sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: Thus, monks, the spiritual life is lived in dependence on each other for the purpose of crossing over the flood, for attaining wisdom, and for the complete destruction of suffering and despair.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“The householder and the one gone forth,
both dependent on each other,
practice the true Dhamma,
the unsurpassed security from bondage.

analyzed: sa āgāresu ca  paccayam sayana āsana
translated: And the householders provide robes,🔽requisites, and lodging,
While the homeless provide
for the dispelling of dangers.
But the householders, delighting in the Sugata,
who live in homes and love their homes,🔽having faith in the Worthy Ones,
who meditate with noble wisdom,
having practiced the Dhamma here,
the path that leads to good destinations,
rejoice in the world of the gods,
enjoying sensual pleasures as they will.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said, so I have heard.
The eighth.
